page.title: 11Transport in Stevington
page.content: The village of Stevington can be reached by road from three directions,east,west and south.Public transport consists of a bus service which runs to and from Bedford five times every day except Sundays.On the main A.428 road buses run to Oxford, Cambridge and Northampton calling at intermediate villages.A large number of families have one car,some have two and a few have three (but usually belonging to grownup children).Pedal bicycles and motorbikes are also popular especially among the younger people.Special buses transport the children to schools in Bromham,Oakley and Sharnbrook.
